poem:
**The Invisibles**

In corridors unseen, wealth flows  
like whispers in the court's hollow;  
a crownless head, yet cushions soft  
bear the weight of untold proceeds,  
spun by hands not his own.  
In silence's embrace, gold gleams—  
the world a stage, and shadows deep,  
with truths hidden beneath royal seams.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How does he pay for it all? The mystery of Prince Andrew’s money default It is one of the mysteries of the modern monarchy – and one that is under more scrutiny than ever before. How on earth does Prince Andrew fund his lifestyle? This is a man who has lived a life of luxury for decades, been an outcast for years because of his association with Jeffrey Epstein, yet has no visible means of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
